â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk: Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact: HIGH)                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload         â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious fragments are combined over multiple â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement sliding window verification. 2) Use    â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate       â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)                                   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers: Supplement prompt-based safety with        â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2)      â”‚
â”‚    Output Level: Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP Natural      â”‚
â”‚    Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice controllers. (Impact: HIGH)   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sovereign Model Migration Opportunity: Detected OpenAI dependency. For â”‚
â”‚    maximum Data Sovereignty and 40% TCO reduction, consider pivoting to   â”‚
â”‚    Gemma2 or Llama3-70B on Vertex AI Prediction endpoints. (Impact: HIGH) â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Legacy REST vs MCP: Pivot to Model Context Protocol (MCP) for tool     â”‚
â”‚    discovery. OpenAI, Anthropic, and Microsoft (Agent Kit) are converging â”‚
â”‚    on MCP for standardized tool/resource governance. (Impact: HIGH)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement: Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI:  â”‚
â”‚    Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed schema. 2) GCP: Application    â”‚
â”‚    Mimetype (application/json) enforcement. 3) LangGraph: Pydantic-based  â”‚
â”‚    state validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive static context (>5k chars)         â”‚
â”‚    detected in system instruction. This risks 'Lost in the Middle'        â”‚
â”‚    hallucinations. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Resiliency Pattern: Agent calls external APIs but lacks retry  â”‚
â”‚    logic. (Impact: HIGH)                                                  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ EU Data Sovereignty Gap: Compliance code detected but no European      â”‚
â”‚    region routing found. Risk of non-compliance with EU data residency    â”‚
â”‚    laws. (Impact: HIGH)                                                   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Direct Vendor SDK Exposure: Directly importing 'vertexai'. Consider    â”‚
â”‚    wrapping in a provider-agnostic bridge to allow Multi-Cloud mobility.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                                                          â”‚

â”‚    For a 'Category Killer' grade, implement an abstraction layer that     â”‚
â”‚    allows switching to Gemma 2 on GKE. (Impact: INFO)                     â”‚

â”‚    edge. Reasoning: Token cost for Feb 2026 frontier models makes SLM     â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When evaluating orchestration,        â”‚
â”‚    consider: 1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state machines with     â”‚
â”‚    persistence (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 'Workflows over Agents' for        â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.                                             â”‚

â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted ePHI: Database interaction detected  â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret management headers. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06): Audit tool permissions     â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚
â”‚    tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive actions    â”‚
â”‚    (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for Python execution. (Impact:    â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚

â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚

â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload         â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious fragments are combined over multiple â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement sliding window verification. 2) Use    â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate       â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)                                   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚

â”‚    wrapping in a provider-agnostic bridge to allow Multi-Cloud mobility.  â”‚

â”‚    For a 'Category Killer' grade, implement an abstraction layer that     â”‚
â”‚    allows switching to Gemma 2 on GKE. (Impact: INFO)                     â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Compute Scaling Optimization: Detected complex scaling logic. If       â”‚
â”‚    traffic exceeds 10k RPS, consider pivoting from Cloud Run to GKE with  â”‚
â”‚    Anthos for hybrid-cloud sovereignty. (Impact: INFO)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚

â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01): Don't leave users guessing. â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 2) UI:      â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3)           â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚

â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud Run detected. MISSING              â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes the â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM workloads are Memory-Bound           â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB). (Impact: LOW)                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚

â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚

â”‚    discovery. OpenAI, Anthropic, and Microsoft (Agent Kit) are converging â”‚
â”‚    on MCP for standardized tool/resource governance. (Impact: HIGH)       â”‚

â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚

â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes the â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚

â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact: HIGH)                                â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Legacy REST vs MCP: Pivot to Model Context Protocol (MCP) for tool     â”‚
â”‚    discovery. OpenAI, Anthropic, and Microsoft (Agent Kit) are converging â”‚
â”‚    on MCP for standardized tool/resource governance. (Impact: HIGH)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Prompt Injection Susceptibility: The variable 'query' flows into an    â”‚
â”‚    LLM call without detected sanitization logic (e.g., scrub/guard).      â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive static context (>5k chars)         â”‚
â”‚    detected in system instruction. This risks 'Lost in the Middle'        â”‚
â”‚    hallucinations. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Inference Cost Projection (gemini-3-pro): Detected gemini-3-pro usage  â”‚
â”‚    (SINGLE PASS). Projected TCO over 1M tokens: $2.50. (Impact: INFO)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted ePHI: Database interaction detected  â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret management headers. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk: Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact: HIGH)                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Vector Store Evolution (Chroma DB): For enterprise scaling, evaluate:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Google Cloud: Vertex AI Search for handled grounding. 2) AWS:       â”‚
â”‚    Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases. 3) General: BigQuery Vector Search for â”‚
â”‚    high-scale analytical joins. (Impact: HIGH)                            â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When evaluating orchestration,        â”‚
â”‚    consider: 1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state machines with     â”‚
â”‚    persistence (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 'Workflows over Agents' for        â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.                                             â”‚
â”‚                                                                           â”‚
â”‚ [CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal (ArXiv): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: ArXiv             â”‚
â”‚ Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)                            â”‚
â”‚                                                                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload         â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious fragments are combined over multiple â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement sliding window verification. 2) Use    â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate       â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)                                   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers: Supplement prompt-based safety with        â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2)      â”‚
â”‚    Output Level: Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP Natural      â”‚
â”‚    Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice controllers. (Impact: HIGH)   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden Signals): Monitor the Agentic Trinity:   â”‚
â”‚    1) Reasoning Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First Token        â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06): Audit tool permissions     â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚
â”‚    tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive actions    â”‚
â”‚    (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for Python execution. (Impact:    â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Conflict: Multi-Orchestrator Setup: Detected both LangGraph  â”‚
â”‚    and CrewAI. Using two loop managers is a 'High-Entropy' pattern that   â”‚
â”‚    often leads to cyclic state deadlocks. (Impact: HIGH)                  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive static context (>5k chars)         â”‚
â”‚    detected in system instruction. This risks 'Lost in the Middle'        â”‚
â”‚    hallucinations. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Exit Plan (Cloud): Detected hardcoded cloud dependencies.    â”‚
â”‚    For a 'Category Killer' grade, implement an abstraction layer that     â”‚
â”‚    allows switching to Gemma 2 on GKE. (Impact: INFO)                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud Run detected. Startup Boost        â”‚
â”‚    active. A slow TTR makes the agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival'  â”‚
â”‚    for users. (Impact: INFO)                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk: Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact: HIGH)                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM workloads are Memory-Bound           â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB). (Impact: LOW)                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sovereign Model Migration Opportunity: Detected OpenAI dependency. For â”‚
â”‚    maximum Data Sovereignty and 40% TCO reduction, consider pivoting to   â”‚
â”‚    Gemma2 or Llama3-70B on Vertex AI Prediction endpoints. (Impact: HIGH) â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Enterprise Identity (Identity Sprawl): Move beyond static keys.        â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) GCP: Workload Identity Federation. 2) AWS: Private VPC   â”‚
â”‚    Endpoints + IAM Role-based access. 3) Azure: Managed Identities for    â”‚
â”‚    all tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL)                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers: Supplement prompt-based safety with        â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2)      â”‚
â”‚    Output Level: Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP Natural      â”‚
â”‚    Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice controllers. (Impact: HIGH)   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement: Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI:  â”‚
â”‚    Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed schema. 2) GCP: Application    â”‚
â”‚    Mimetype (application/json) enforcement. 3) LangGraph: Pydantic-based  â”‚
â”‚    state validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden Signals): Monitor the Agentic Trinity:   â”‚
â”‚    1) Reasoning Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First Token        â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01): Don't leave users guessing. â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 2) UI:      â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3)           â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agent Starter Pack Template Adoption: Leverage production-grade        â”‚
â”‚    Generative AI templates from the                                       â”‚
â”‚    GoogleCloudPlatform/agent-starter-pack. Benefits: 1) Pre-built         â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph patterns. 2) IAM-hardened deployments. 3) Standardized       â”‚
â”‚    tool-use hooks. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Incompatible Duo: langgraph + crewai: CrewAI and LangGraph both        â”‚
â”‚    attempt to manage the orchestration loop and state, leading to         â”‚
â”‚    cyclic-dependency conflicts. (Impact: CRITICAL)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Incompatible Duo: google-adk + pyautogen: AutoGen's conversational     â”‚
â”‚    loop pattern conflicts with ADK's strictly typed tool orchestration.   â”‚
â”‚    Pair with Agent Starter Pack for tracing, observability, and logging   â”‚
â”‚    best practices. (Impact: CRITICAL)                                     â”‚

â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06): Audit tool permissions     â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚
â”‚    tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive actions    â”‚
â”‚    (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for Python execution. (Impact:    â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud Run detected. MISSING              â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes the â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM workloads are Memory-Bound           â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB). (Impact: LOW)                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden Signals): Monitor the Agentic Trinity:   â”‚
â”‚    1) Reasoning Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First Token        â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Conflict: Multi-Orchestrator Setup: Detected both LangGraph  â”‚
â”‚    and CrewAI. Using two loop managers is a 'High-Entropy' pattern that   â”‚
â”‚    often leads to cyclic state deadlocks. (Impact: HIGH)                  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted ePHI: Database interaction detected  â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret management headers. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk: Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact: HIGH)                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Vector Store Evolution (Chroma DB): For enterprise scaling, evaluate:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Google Cloud: Vertex AI Search for handled grounding. 2) AWS:       â”‚
â”‚    Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases. 3) General: BigQuery Vector Search for â”‚
â”‚    high-scale analytical joins. (Impact: HIGH)                            â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload         â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious fragments are combined over multiple â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement sliding window verification. 2) Use    â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate       â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)                                   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement: Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI:  â”‚
â”‚    Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed schema. 2) GCP: Application    â”‚
â”‚    Mimetype (application/json) enforcement. 3) LangGraph: Pydantic-based  â”‚
â”‚    state validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06): Audit tool permissions     â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚
â”‚    tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive actions    â”‚
â”‚    (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for Python execution. (Impact:    â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agent Starter Pack Template Adoption: Leverage production-grade        â”‚
â”‚    Generative AI templates from the                                       â”‚
â”‚    GoogleCloudPlatform/agent-starter-pack. Benefits: 1) Pre-built         â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph patterns. 2) IAM-hardened deployments. 3) Standardized       â”‚
â”‚    tool-use hooks. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Incompatible Duo: langgraph + crewai: CrewAI and LangGraph both        â”‚
â”‚    attempt to manage the orchestration loop and state, leading to         â”‚
â”‚    cyclic-dependency conflicts. (Impact: CRITICAL)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚

â”‚    on MCP for standardized tool/resource governance. (Impact: HIGH)       â”‚

â”‚    all tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL)                              â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01): Don't leave users guessing. â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 2) UI:      â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3)           â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ High Hallucination Risk: System prompt lacks negative constraints      â”‚
â”‚    (e.g., 'If you don't know, say I don't know'). (Impact: HIGH)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Schema-less A2A Handshake: Agent-to-Agent call detected without        â”‚
â”‚    explicit input/output schema validation. High risk of 'Reasoning       â”‚
â”‚    Drift'. (Impact: HIGH)                                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers: Supplement prompt-based safety with        â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2)      â”‚
â”‚    Output Level: Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP Natural      â”‚
â”‚    Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice controllers. (Impact: HIGH)   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Enterprise Identity (Identity Sprawl): Move beyond static keys.        â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) GCP: Workload Identity Federation. 2) AWS: Private VPC   â”‚
â”‚    Endpoints + IAM Role-based access. 3) Azure: Managed Identities for    â”‚
â”‚    all tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL)                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06): Audit tool permissions     â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚
â”‚    tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive actions    â”‚
â”‚    (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for Python execution. (Impact:    â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted ePHI: Database interaction detected  â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret management headers. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud Run detected. MISSING              â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes the â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Regional Proximity Breach: Detected cross-region latency (>100ms).     â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning (LLM) and Retrieval (Vector DB) must be co-located in the    â”‚
â”‚    same zone to hit <10ms tail latency. (Impact: HIGH)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload         â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious fragments are combined over multiple â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement sliding window verification. 2) Use    â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate       â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)                                   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement: Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI:  â”‚
â”‚    Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed schema. 2) GCP: Application    â”‚
â”‚    Mimetype (application/json) enforcement. 3) LangGraph: Pydantic-based  â”‚
â”‚    state validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden Signals): Monitor the Agentic Trinity:   â”‚
â”‚    1) Reasoning Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First Token        â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚

â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚

â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ High Hallucination Risk: System prompt lacks negative constraints      â”‚
â”‚    (e.g., 'If you don't know, say I don't know'). (Impact: HIGH)          â”‚

â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk: Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact: HIGH)                                â”‚

â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚

â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚

â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚

â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚

â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚

â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Conflict: Multi-Orchestrator Setup: Detected both LangGraph  â”‚
â”‚    and CrewAI. Using two loop managers is a 'High-Entropy' pattern that   â”‚
â”‚    often leads to cyclic state deadlocks. (Impact: HIGH)                  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive static context (>5k chars)         â”‚
â”‚    detected in system instruction. This risks 'Lost in the Middle'        â”‚
â”‚    hallucinations. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Vector Networking (REST): Detected REST-based vector       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval. High-concurrency agents should use gRPC to reduce           â”‚
â”‚    'Cognitive Tax' by 40% and prevent tail-latency spikes. (Impact:       â”‚
â”‚    MEDIUM)                                                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud Run detected. MISSING              â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes the â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM workloads are Memory-Bound           â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB). (Impact: LOW)                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sovereign Model Migration Opportunity: Detected OpenAI dependency. For â”‚
â”‚    maximum Data Sovereignty and 40% TCO reduction, consider pivoting to   â”‚
â”‚    Gemma2 or Llama3-70B on Vertex AI Prediction endpoints. (Impact: HIGH) â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Compute Scaling Optimization: Detected complex scaling logic. If       â”‚
â”‚    traffic exceeds 10k RPS, consider pivoting from Cloud Run to GKE with  â”‚
â”‚    Anthos for hybrid-cloud sovereignty. (Impact: INFO)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Vector Store Evolution (Chroma DB): For enterprise scaling, evaluate:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Google Cloud: Vertex AI Search for handled grounding. 2) AWS:       â”‚
â”‚    Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases. 3) General: BigQuery Vector Search for â”‚
â”‚    high-scale analytical joins. (Impact: HIGH)                            â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden Signals): Monitor the Agentic Trinity:   â”‚
â”‚    1) Reasoning Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First Token        â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06): Audit tool permissions     â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚
â”‚    tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive actions    â”‚
â”‚    (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for Python execution. (Impact:    â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01): Don't leave users guessing. â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 2) UI:      â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3)           â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agent Starter Pack Template Adoption: Leverage production-grade        â”‚
â”‚    Generative AI templates from the                                       â”‚
â”‚    GoogleCloudPlatform/agent-starter-pack. Benefits: 1) Pre-built         â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph patterns. 2) IAM-hardened deployments. 3) Standardized       â”‚
â”‚    tool-use hooks. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Incompatible Duo: langgraph + crewai: CrewAI and LangGraph both        â”‚
â”‚    attempt to manage the orchestration loop and state, leading to         â”‚
â”‚    cyclic-dependency conflicts. (Impact: CRITICAL)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚

â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚

â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud Run detected. MISSING              â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes the â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚

â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB). (Impact: LOW)                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When evaluating orchestration,        â”‚
â”‚    consider: 1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state machines with     â”‚
â”‚    persistence (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 'Workflows over Agents' for        â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.                                             â”‚

â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious fragments are combined over multiple â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement sliding window verification. 2) Use    â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate       â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)                                   â”‚

â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact: HIGH)                                â”‚

â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive static context (>5k chars)         â”‚
â”‚    detected in system instruction. This risks 'Lost in the Middle'        â”‚
â”‚    hallucinations. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted ePHI: Database interaction detected  â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret management headers. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When evaluating orchestration,        â”‚
â”‚    consider: 1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state machines with     â”‚
â”‚    persistence (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 'Workflows over Agents' for        â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.                                             â”‚
â”‚                                                                           â”‚
â”‚ [CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal (ArXiv): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: ArXiv             â”‚
â”‚ Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)                            â”‚
â”‚                                                                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01): Don't leave users guessing. â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 2) UI:      â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3)           â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted ePHI: Database interaction detected  â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret management headers. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden Signals): Monitor the Agentic Trinity:   â”‚
â”‚    1) Reasoning Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First Token        â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted ePHI: Database interaction detected  â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret management headers. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing GenUI Surface Mapping: Agent is returning raw HTML/UI strings  â”‚
â”‚    without A2UI surfaceId mapping. This breaks the 'Push-based GenUI'     â”‚
â”‚    standard. (Impact: HIGH)                                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud Run detected. MISSING              â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes the â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing           â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM workloads are Memory-Bound           â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB). (Impact: LOW)                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement: Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI:  â”‚
â”‚    Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed schema. 2) GCP: Application    â”‚
â”‚    Mimetype (application/json) enforcement. 3) LangGraph: Pydantic-based  â”‚
â”‚    state validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden Signals): Monitor the Agentic Trinity:   â”‚
â”‚    1) Reasoning Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First Token        â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit recommends             â”‚
â”‚    'Trace-based Debugging' for multi-agent loops. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06): Audit tool permissions     â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM for â”‚
â”‚    tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive actions    â”‚
â”‚    (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for Python execution. (Impact:    â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11): Ensure users understand      â”‚
â”‚    'Why' the agent took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX: Make â”‚
â”‚    clear 'Why' the system did what it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the       â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces behind 'View   â”‚
â”‚    Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)                                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: For high-stakes reasoning, move  â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent  â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore        â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3) Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own      â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline.   â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments' in fetched  â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts that forbid following instructions   â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model scans   â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01): Don't leave users guessing. â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 2) UI:      â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3)           â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop: Detected a self-referencing agent call â”‚
â”‚    pattern. Risk of infinite reasoning loops and runaway costs. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc context â”‚
â”‚    passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent Protocol v2)   â”‚
â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚

â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the primary   â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence. (Impact: MEDIUM)                    â”‚

â”‚    Endpoints + IAM Role-based access. 3) Azure: Managed Identities for    â”‚
â”‚    all tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL)                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers: Supplement prompt-based safety with        â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2)      â”‚
â”‚    Output Level: Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP Natural      â”‚
â”‚    Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice controllers. (Impact: HIGH)   â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When evaluating orchestration,        â”‚
â”‚    consider: 1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state machines with     â”‚
â”‚    persistence (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 'Workflows over Agents' for        â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.                                             â”‚

â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: ArXiv             â”‚
â”‚ Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)                            â”‚
â”‚                                                                           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming): Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)   â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive  â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned response check). 5)      â”‚
â”‚    Language (Non-supported language override). (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex    â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. This replaces rigid  â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic state-based event loop that is more       â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents. (Impact: HIGH)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate Recursive â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion. Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents         â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                                                     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SLM-on-the-Edge (Gemma 3 / Phi-4 Optimization): Offload deterministic  â”‚
â”‚    sub-tasks (JSON parsing, routing) to Gemma 3-2b or Phi-4-mini on local â”‚
â”‚    edge. Reasoning: Token cost for Feb 2026 frontier models makes SLM     â”‚
â”‚    offloading an 85% OpEx win. (Impact: HIGH)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit Logging: Structural logging          â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)                                      â”‚

â”‚    CRITICAL)                                                              â”‚

â”‚    ensures cross-framework interoperability. (Impact: LOW)                â”‚
